content:
There are a couple places in our app where we say "you" (or "You") to indicate that the app is talking about you, the user:

  • buddy list hover (over your own name)
  • reactions (where you reacted)

Are we 100% sure that we don't want to say "me" there? I think @Vlad Korobov has argued for this on another topic. I mostly lean to "You", but I think it's kind of subjective.
Yeah, first person seems weird there. Imagine if Zulip was telling you this in a full sentence: “I have reacted to this message”?
It looks like for emoji reactions, Discord uses your name and Slack uses "you".
A way I think about "you" is that it's the app telling me information. Usually I think of "me" as coming from my own voice, and I don't read the app's voice as my own voice.
